Pages.Title: Title
Pages.Sequencetheparticularbanner: You can define the position or the sequence the particular banner will appear on the home page, in the auto scroll.
Pages.Bannersadvertisementappearingparagraph: Banners are advertisement appearing on a web page in the form of a bar, column, or box. You can provide a name or a title for the banner that is going to come on the home page.
Pages.Purposeofthebanner: You can provide a content for the banner that can include the purpose of the banner, offer associated the banner and the products are categories the banners are tagged to.
Pages.TheeCommerceportal: You can provide one of the URL links within the eCommerce portal in order navigate the user to a particular category or product page, from the home page banner.
Pages.Addmultipleages: You can provide a name for the group under which you can add multiple ages. The group name shall be commonly suitable one for all the pages that come under that group. For example, under the page group – User Policies, you can add pages like terms of use, privacy policy etc.
Pages.Thegroupnameactiveorinactive: You can choose to keep the group name active or inactive – active when you want to display it to the end users in the storefront or inactive, when you want to hide it from the users. You can always activate the inactivated group name.

paragraph.AdminProfile: This section will have admin user name, admin email id, admin phone number and address of the admin. It is recommended that this section shall have correct information and shall be latest updated, especially the phone number and the email Id of the admin, as it can change from time to time. Such changes shall be updated on an immediate basis and saved.
paragraph.Localizationadaptation: Localization is the adaptation of the eCommerce business to a certain country and zone and configuring of the local currency, delivery locations and taxes that is applicable for the business.
paragraph.createandmaintainthemasterlist: In this section, the admin can create and maintain the master list of different order status – say for example, order confirmed, out for delivery and so on.
paragraph.admincanaddvarioustaxes: In this section, the admin can add various taxes that will be applicable on various products that will be sold on the eCommerce portal. This will be available for selection to state the applicable tax on the price of the product, while listing the product.
paragraph.Masterlistofcountries: In this section, the admin can maintain the master list of countries. They can choose any one zone from this list that will be available in the general settings for configuring the zone to which the eCommerce business belongs to.
paragraph.Admincanconfigurethepermissions: In this section, the admin can configure the permissions for the change of order status by Admin, Vendor and Buyer. E.g., Admin will have the right to change any order status, ranging from order accepted till order delivered. Vendor may not have the permission to confirm an order, but can have the permission to change the order status of ready for dispatch and shipped. Customers may have the permission for order cancellation and return request.
paragraph.Aprovisionforadding: A provision for adding a new status in the master list has been provided. E.g., Ready for pick up from warehouse. Create one
paragraph.Aprovisionforaddingaddinganewstatus: A provision for adding a new status in the master list, during the packaging stage. E.g., Ready for dispatch. Create one
paragraph.OrdercancelledCreateone: A provision for adding a new status in the master list, for the cancellation stages. E.g., Order  cancelled. Create one
paragraph.OrderonholdCreateone: A provision for adding a new status in the master list, when the order is on hold. E.g., Order on hold.  Create one
paragraph.returnreceivedCreate: A provision for adding a new status in the master list, post return order arrives. E.g., return received. Create
paragraph.DeliveredCreateone: A provision for adding a new status in the master list, post delivery. E.g., Delivered. Create one
paragraph.Inquopertineant: In quo pertineant non fuisse torquem detraxit hosti et quidem exercitus quid ex eo delectu rerum, quem ad eam non ero tibique, si mihi probabis ea, quae sine causa? quae fuerit causa, nollem me ab eo delectu rerum, quem.
paragraph.Forsendingnotifications: In this section, the can manage and maintain the subject and content of the email templates that will be used for sending notifications to Vendor, Customers and Admin themselves, in different instances.
paragraph.Displayoftheproductlistandorderlist: The admin can configure the display of the product list and order list in this section. The admin can configure this at their convenience and decide on how many products or orders should be shown in the product master list page and order master list page.
paragraph.Admincanconfigurethenumberoforders: The admin can configure the number of orders per page in this section What is required here?
paragraph.Commonprefixforalltheordernumbers: The admin can provide the invoice prefix that will follow the order number here. This will be the common prefix for all the order numbers. The admin can also set up the default order status once it is placed by the Customer.
paragraph.Numberofproductsperpage: The admin can configure number of products per page in this section
paragraph.Productsineachcategoryalso: The admin can set up the default number for display of items per page and this can be based on the number or products in each category also.
paragraph.Facebookpagelink: In this section, the admin can provide social media page links of eCommerce portal – Facebook page link, Twitter page link and Instagram page link.
paragraph.AdaptationoftheeCommercebusiness: AddOns is the adaptation of the eCommerce business to a certain payment gateway
paragraph.Admincancreateandmaintain: In this section, the admin can create and maintain a master list of different aspects that will be required for an enhanced approach for listing products, providing a good shopping experience to the customers and also for making the entire eCommerce portal SEO friendly.
paragraph.SEOfriendlywithmetatags: This is the section that is dedicated for making the entire site SEO friendly with meta tags. Here, the admin can provide the title, description and keywords that will bring the eCommerce portal on the top in the search engine rankings.
paragraph.Setupthecountry: In this section, the admin can setup the country, origin or region, language and currency for business, depending on the location it is situated.

nav.SettingOrder: In this section the admin can create and maintain different admin roles and permissions. Then, permissions can be assigned for the roles there of. Based on the permission assigned, different roles can access modules for which they have permission.Then, the admin can create users and assign the user to a role and the user will have only those permissions that will be assigned to that role
nav.SuperAdmin: The super admin can add different roles here and assign permissions to the roles. By defining the permissions, the super admin will be either giving the privilege to the role to access certain modules and at the same time will be restricting the userfrom accessing certain other modules.
nav.Superadmin: The super admin can add different users and assign the users to a particular role. The users will be able to access only those modules to which they are granted the permission to access.
nav.Add-ON: Add-onThe Admin can choose to configure any of these available add-ons. is an extension for the base script or software that can be added to have additional features for your eCommerce portal.
nav.Name: Name
nav.AdminHeader: The Admin can choose to configure any of these available add-ons.
nav.Adminheader: In this section, the admin can maintain the master list of countries. They can choose any one country from this list that will be available in the general settings for configuring the country to which the eCommerce business belongs to.
nav.AddonAdaptation: AddOns is the adaptation of the eCommerce business to a certain payment gateway.
nav.AdminNote: The Admin can choose to configure any of these available add-ons.
nav.Generalsetting: General Settings is where the critical eCommerce settings are configured to get started with eCommerce portal
nav.BasicGeneralInformation: In this section, the admin can provide the name of the business, owner details, contact email and phone number and the physical address of the company.
nav.GeneralSiteSettings: In this section, the admin can maintain the master list of countries. They can choose any one country from this list that will be available in the general settings for configuring the country to which the eCommerce business belongs to.
nav.NotesInformation: In this section, admin can maintain the master list of currencies and admin can choose any one currency from this list that will be available in the general settings for configuring the currency in which the price of the products will be shown in the eCommerce portal.
nav.AdminLanguage: The admin can add different languages here, for the International Customers to choose the language of preference from the storefront.
nav.LocalizationAdaptation: Localization is the adaptation of the eCommerce business to a certain country and zone and configuring of the local...
nav.AdminSection: In this section the admin can create  and maintain different admin roles and permissions.
nav.Adminsheader: From this section,the admin can have system level configurations such as switching over the entire...
nav.AdminConfigure: The admin can configure the display of the product list and order list in this section.
nav.Adminsection: In this section, the admin can create and maintain a master list of different aspects that will be required for an..
nav.Adminrequire: In this section,the admin can create and maintain a master list of different aspects that will be required for an...
nav.AdminCreate: In this section,the admin can create and maintain a plugin.
nav.SettingAdmin: In this section, the admin will have the track of all the admin activities – when a particular admin user accessed, which module they accessed and made any changes in the module, along with the date and the time log. An option for selection of datesis provided to delete the logs between a certain period.
nav.PleaseChooseAtleastonedate: Please Choose At least one date
nav.AdminSMTP: Here, the admin can configure the SMTP for sending email notifications to the Vendors and Customers. The development of this section is in progress and will be made available soon.
nav.adminConfigure: Here the admin can configure the SMS for sending text notifications to the Vendors and Customers. The development of this section is in progress and will be made available soon.
nav.SystemSection: In this section, the Admin can configure those aspects that are global and applies to the entire portal. For example, setting the portal to maintenance mode, configuring email credentials, SMTP and SMS.
nav.SettingEnabling: By enabling this, the admin will be stopping the end-users/customers from doing any kind of activity – browsing and searching for products or doing an online purchase, on the eCommerce portal. The admin can use this option, whenever they need to make any update or enhancement to the eCommerce portal. This way, they will be informing the Customers about the same, and requesting for their patience, while they are updating or enhancing the eCommerce portal.
nav.SettingEntermaintenance: Would you like to turn on the maintenance mode for your eCommerce portal? Remember that your customers will not be able to carry out any activity on the eCommerce portal, when maintenance mode is enabled.

reports.TheeCommerce: The eCommerce reports are the main KPI (key performance indicators). It is a great way to get a snapshot of what is happening in the business, in terms of revenue, conversion rates, transaction volume, average order value month over month and revenue from time to time.
reports.TheSalesbyVendorreport: The Sales by Vendor report shows the total sales of products listed by a particular list of Vendors (one or more). This is a good report that indicates, which Vendor is making good sales through the platform. You can either choose to see the total sales by all the Vendors or choose a particular list of Vendors to get the sales report by them. Also, you can specify a date range to know the sales by Vendors, during a period.
reports.TotalSalesReportis: Total Sales Report is a good report that indicates the total sales during a period, say in a month or three months or last six months. You can also specify a date range and price range to know the sales that has happened within a specified period and within a specified price range.
reports.Youcangetareport: You can get a report on the settlement you have made for different orders of each vendor. You can choose a Vendor, choose a particular date range and also select whether you want to see all the settlements or ones that are settled or ones that are not settled.
